reviews.text: Let’s start with the fact that there’s 24/7 free coffee ☕️. It’s a great Irish inspired hotel, central to all the DC attractions making it a great spot if you’re up for a day of walking. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean and well kept. Possibly the best part is the attached pub that reminds me of the pubs I visited in Ireland a few months prior. You’ll get a good pint of Guinness and it even has the same scent as the pubs in Ireland. A great choice for a weekend in DC. Can’t forget about the speedy valet service as well! Highly recommended.

My friend and I stayed here when we were going to be in DC for a concert. The room was small, but perfect for what we needed. The room was clean and the bathroom was gorgeous. Staff at all times were friendly and helpful. It was about a 15 minute walk to Capital One Arena and you were so close to the Capital Building you could see it! Very enjoyable stay, I would come back. They even have a super cool latte machine that can be used for free as a guest!

This is a GREAT hotel to stay in if you are visiting Washington DC. It’s small enough to give you very personal service. The bellmen hailed cabs quickly and cheerfully. The housekeeping service was daily! They worked around our schedule with no problem. One night, we had noisy neighbors. When we called, the staff took care of it immediately. We were there six nights. The breakfast a la cart was very reasonable. $7 for made to order eggs and bacon. Great French Toast! The Dubliner, connected to the hotel, was great if you wanted dinner quickly. Great location not far from the sites and close to union station. We would definitely stay again.

Stayed here for a belated birthday weekend in D.C.. The entire staff was so kind and helpful. Beds were amazing and the rooms were very clean. Views from our room were really pretty, and the complimentary coffee/espresso bar was extremely convenient. I would definitely recommend this hotel. The only downside is the surrounding location is a little bit sketchy. Lots of homeless people at night, some seemed to be clearly mentally ill. This is no fault of the hotel though.

First thing first this place was cute and inviting. The staff always said good morning and good evening. The bed was super comfy the pillows were like sleeping on clouds. The water was super hot like which was a relief from the cold as we went in January. The dubliner restaurant had delicious breakfast and late night dinner. I would go back again.

The food was great and service was fast.
I like their classic diner-like atmosphere.  I would highly recommend this place. We got apple cider pancakes and their tomato soup with grilled cheese sandwich. The milkshake were very good and a great deal. The Irish coffee was also excellent and would recommend to warm up with during winter.

I’d give it 3.5/5. Some of the food was good, some was on the level of Waffle House. Our server had a lot of energy on a Sunday at 2:30, but we had to get up for our own silverware after we got the food. Same with ketchup, etc. My order was wrong. The servers were making their own drinks and loudly joking amongst themselves while the service was lacking. And the hostess was at a table eating out in the front. Doesn’t seem like the most professional staff. Strange vibe. The ahi tuna sandwich was good. Avoid the TUBS dish and the sangria. All sugar, no alcohol.

The food was excellent, although the corned beef hash was extremely salty. I loved the smoked salmon rangoons, and thought it was the highlight of the meal. The biscuits and gravy were also stellar too, and that dish was HUGE. I enjoyed the banana cream pie, but thought the crust was too thick. The only downside was that the place was a bit too loud music-wise and our server seemed disinterested in serving us

Amazing ambiance. I love the vibe there. Family friendly but also very chill. We got the short rib roast dinner. It was so tender and flavorful. The mashed potatoes were super creamy. Great carrots.

Carrot cake was yummy and enormous. Just a bit dry. Huge fan and planning to come for breakfast.

They open early, this is a huge plus. Parking was easy and it wasn’t crowded so we were seated immediately. Our server, Karen was far from what you would think of when you hear Karen. Very polite, attentive, helpful, and professional. Our food was served quick and she even complimented our looks, huge plus. I have no complaints, the food was delicious and I appreciated the pleasant experience.

Boutique beer garden, nice space and quick service. Unexpectedly walked in on a rainy Friday and was pleasantly surprised. Definitely recommend it for having a beer in a more informal setting.

The place is very nice, with wide industrial interior design. It’s located in a walkable neighborhood surrounded by relatively new buildings.

Finally, it offers a wide variety of local beer, tasty American cuisine, many televisions to broadcast your favorite sports and you can order through your phone.

We stopped in for a late lunch/early dinner just 2 of us on a Saturday at 4:30. We were lucky to have a table open upstairs and sat immediately.  They have QR codes at each table - you order and pay and tip all online.  Each QR is unique to each table and the servers bring out the food. We ordered the pastrami sandwich with fries and the shredded pork sub tots. The food came out quickly and hot.  The pastrami was great and so was the shredded pork. The tots were “weird “. I think they were fried squares of mashed potatoes.  The place was bustling and full. The bathrooms needed attention.

Stopped by before the Nationals game against the Atlanta Braves for some good beer. This place doesn’t disappoint… there is a wide variety of beautiful local craft beer. I had the DIPA Rainbow and it was awesome. Even though we didn’t get food … I wish we did because it looked so good. Friendly staff … but even better beer. I wish i could have taken a 4 pack into the game!!!!

I love this place. I will be back and back again. Drinks are good. House beers are very good. Strawberry Sky on a hot July day is a great cure for DC muggy heat.
Price is better than Georgetown.
Enjoy
(Look a Walgreens flag).

Food is delicious! We ate outside. They offer indoor and outdoor seating. We didn’t love the service, mainly because they use a QR code for the menu and you pay for your food in advance. Some people love that, but it felt like ordering carry out and getting it served to you at the table. Eventually, a server came and brought us hard copies of the menu and took our order. The ladies’ bathroom needed attention. I would go back again because the food was great and it could’ve been a tough night in terms of the restrooms.

Great fillet mignon center steak! Awesome oyster, so fresh and I particularly love the sour red sauce that comes with it. I think it is tomato based.

We asked for medium for the new york stripe but it was a bit too dry. Asparagus was splendid, perfectly cooked. Atmosphere was nice too.

Ok so we were excited to experience this place for our anniversary. Sadly we was highly disappointed. 1st we were shoved in a corner that wasn't comfortable especially with me being 8 months pregnant, and when I asked the hostess can we have another seat placement she just looked at me as if I spoke another language.  The service was subpar. It was too many times during our meal the waiter didn't show back up for long periods and we were left waiting looking crazy. The food was ok, steak was great the bearnaise sauce was horrible, mushrooms were too tough to chew. I was hoping you at least get a complimentary dessert for our anniversary and we did not get anything except a meal that wasn't enjoyable. The ambiance was however nice. Would I be back...most likely not.

I had a great experience. I ordered the lobster linguini and it was absolutely delicious. I also had to have asparagus and it was cooked perfectly and great flavors. I had a few servers: Gustavo, Rodrigo, and 2/3 more. The service was spot on. I was taken care of. I would come back for the environment, music, service, and food.

I decided to try CPSH and to my delight it was amazing! The staff truly make the experience memorable. You must try their trio crème brûlée Exceptional
Ohhhhhh and the French onion soup…… on point
Great place for business lunch. I got the crab cakes and it was amazing! More filling than i thought. I'd like to return and try their steaks.

I went to matchbox with a group of 10 people for a happy hour after a tour. Their happy hour menu was really good but most of us ended up getting Hot Tea because it was so cold outside. We try almost the entire happy hour menu (except for drink). My personal favorite was the chicken bites. Our host was awesome. He had great energy and got all of our orders correct. I was supposed by how big the restaurant was. There is a ton of space.

Disappointed with management. We went for a bite and drinks before a comedy show. We ordered a beer, a cocktail and a small pizza. All we’re on the happy hour menu.

We got the check and it was all full price. We asked our server about the happy hour price. The manager told him that we would have had to request the happy hour price when we ordered…

I’m just confused because the menus we were given have the happy hour deal right there.

Always enjoy eating here; they have one of the best happy hour menus in the District (DMV) area. The food was great and so was our waiter, my friend and I ordered the Matchbox Meat Pizza, the honey wings and fried risotto.
Only negative I will say is that we pretty much had to seat ourselves the staff were sitting together chatting and laughing at a table. Though I was staying at the entrance no one came to sit us. I had to go to the bartender thinking since it’s happy hour the bar is where we will order. He said no and walked over to his co workers to let them know to assist us. Other than that we had a great time and food.
Had such a great time here! The food was delicious, and the bottomless mimosas had me feeling REAL fine! Great friendly service, and a clean, well run establishment! Highly recommend!!

I hadn’t been here in quite some time but I’m glad I went back. Had the fried chicken sandwich and it was delicious! Large chicken breast, deep fried, and tossed in Buffalo sauce. I had it with just the cabbage on top, and with fries.

Went in on Christmas Eve and it wasn’t busy, service was great, and it was an overall great vibe. I’ll definitely be going back.

One of the greatest dining experiences I've ever had.

the atmosphere, service, food, and drink selection is impeccable.  I dinned over the weekend, and told them I was vegan, and they went above and beyond to fit my dietary restrictions.  They custom made me my own pesto, and adjusted 2 menu items to accommodate.

The pizza they made - was probably the best pizza I've ever had in my life.  the crust was so fresh, as well as the tomatoes and greens that were on top.  it had the snap of toasted crust but a soft bready inside - with the most intense fire roasted brick oven flavor.  absolutely incredible 11 out of 10.

the restaurant itself is super open and clean, and has a warm vibe to it.  if ur in DC - this is a must stop.

The place is nice and the staff very kind!  However we were a little disappointed with the food.  The steak was very fatty and the duck floated in the gravy.  Plus they both arrived cold.  Pity.  The wine list is interesting.  I don't think we'll be back.

Hi during this week which is restaurant week. First entry was watermelon salad. AMAZING. Shrimp scamp for 2nd course. And 3rd course (I can’t believe I ate it all lol), butter beer homemade ice cream.

This restaurant is exquisite. Chef Mel is amazing, he understood my dietary needs and my meal was delicious he even gave me some of the special sauce from my meal to take home.

I must say the front of the house is wonderful also, Juan, Stephen, Jose and Jordan.

Although it had been years since I last visited, I joined some friends here for dinner the weekend after Thanksgiving and had a lovely time. We got the rose and red wine flights and had fun trying each of the very distinct offerings. The food is delicious - we shared the gnocchi, pan seared salmon, and chicken piccata panini. Highly recommend stopping by! There is also private event space available on their second floor.

So I came all the way from Vegas to have a great time with friends, and we made plans to eat at union pub. The atmosphere was nice, but unfortunately the dining experience differed. We had a party of 8 and they couldn't get anyone's order to the right place and they forgot to bring out requested items. This is not a fan fave and I recommend that you save your coins if you can or try something else!!!

Nice outdoor seating area with overhead canopy and some side plexiglass wind protection, but still good air flow. Black bean veggie burger and salad was good option for me as a vegan (minus cheese, of course), and craft beer selection was decent. Or server was attentive and helpful. Alas, the TVs showing a football game were unfortunately quite loud, even after we requested reduced sound level. Oh well. Guessing that doesn't happen all the time. Great location near Union Station Metro and Capitol Hill.

This was the worst experience at a restaurant I’ve ever had. Waiter was very inattentive and seemed agitated when we made simply requests, like that he bring us some clean glasses to drink from instead of dirty ones covered in fingerprints. One of my friends ordered the black bean burger with only lettuce and they brought it to her with no bun….. Just the patty and a piece of lettuce….. Food wasn’t good at all. I had the chicken sliders and was not impressed. Only ate two of the four. Fries were flavorless. The old bay wings were poorly seasoned as well. Chair legs and table legs were both uneven so we were pretty much wobbling the entire time we were trying to eat. Will never be dining here again. 0/5, would NOT recommend! Take your money somewhere else!

Wow the old grumpy barmaid was really rude.  The old lady with white long hair.  She snatched my Visa up and then demanded I sign it. Rude the whole time.  Yelled at me and said other half of bar was closed.  But I was just going to restroom.  Will never be back and tell everyone In DC my experience

Any place with sweet potato fries is already thumbs up for me. Aside from that, the staff was present, and friendly. The food was seasoned just right, and I loved the portions served.

We sat on the patio around lunchtime, which looked like it was used for extra storage space in some sections. A little crowded, the tables and chairs could probably be arranged to better utilize the space, or just use less of them in the space.

Wonderful Sunday brunch experience. We were seated almost immediately. Right away you notice the patio area, welcoming ambiance, great lightning, and a beautiful decor.

Our server, Victor, was amazing and spot-on with his recommendations. We decided to go with the Chef 3 Course Brunch meal, generous amount of food for the price.
I wanted to highlight the Chicken and Waffles, great balance between sweet and spicy. The Strawberry Cinnamon Roll was delicious, not too overwhelming. Our meal also included the Steak and Egg entire, can't go wrong and everything was perfectly cooked and seasoned.

Definitely a great place for brunch, good food, great service, and a laid back atmosphere.

Stopped and had brunch here. The restaurant was big and fancy clean looking on the inside…but they have a big outside area that we had our eyes on.

Food was great! We sampled a number of their brunch options that were all great…with us loving the biscuits and gravy the best!

Their chocolate raspberry tart was pretty darn good too! I would order it again.

The only thing that sucked was the staff, managers and a table of 15 were all fighting over how many tables they could occupy. At first it was… a bit … entertaining… but it kept dragging on and it was clear the situation was bumming everyone out… so we just left.

Would recommend! Would try the place again :)

Had a delicious brunch here..had to make  reservations on resy and it was relatively busy. Outside seating is nice on a summer day. our waiter was great at recommending the top brunch meals. I enjoyed the steak and eggs which came with potatoes..my friend thought the short rib was okay but could have used a bit more seasoning.
We also go a bottle of mimosa and a Caesar salad for starters. In all, worth the visit!

The food here was incredible and I highly recommend the crab deviled eggs along with the short rib hash. They have a variety of options for those that are vegetarian and vegan as well.

I listed my review with 4/5 stars because the customer service from the host stand and the lack of communication from them as well left our wonderful server in a bit of hurry towards the end of our meal. I'm not sure if the hosts were new or just didn't care but it definitely showed.

Overall the food reviews are what brought me to this location and we will absolutely be back for another round.

Make sure to get a seat on the patio!

I took my husband here for a birthday brunch and our waiter Victor impressed us both. He made great recommendations in addition to excellent service. The food was absolutely phenomenal and the cinnamon roll was delightful. They even brought my husband out a nice candle and a dessert! We will definitely be going back here. Excellent food, excellent service, and cool atmosphere.

The most amazing pizza in Washington.
The place has good the perfect vibe. It smells good and have the great customer service.
They have a large varieties of Pizza slice and tastes heaven. Perfectly done, crispy crust and good quality for price.
I tried their Margarita and Spinach Artichoke pizza which were delicious.
They have a good seating area at the top with the screens to watch the game. Highly recommended to visit this place while visiting the Lincoln Memorial.

Smells so good from outside!
The place offers a wide variety of combinations. Salads are included in the menu.

1- Customer service was good, they answered my questions, 😊.
2- Food was very good, I ordered half Ham & Pineapple, half Marketplace (this one I loved it). They offer a homemade sodas, I ordered the Blood Orange... delicious soda 😍.
3- Price per Slice 🍕 $4-$5 I think is over the average. Price for a Medium 14" $21, fair.
4-Place, my table was kinda dancing, I ate outside. Probably it could be better. But inside, the smell and menu presentation was great.

For me the 5 star is because the homemade soda and the people who is working there, they're doing a good job. Thank you!

I was not expecting this pizza to be so delicious but it was. The portions are large and the crust is delicious, not too much sauce and the toppings are fresh and a nice variety.  Their specialty pizzas are so yummy...I had the Greek. You order downstairs and sit upstairs, cool and laid back environment.  You can order by the slice or whole pizzas, decent price point.

Super friendly, great pizza by the slice and beer. Order at counter and eat outside or there is lots of room upstairs.l - light and bright!

We accidentally spilled a beer all over the floor and they were great about cleaning up the mess (and replacing the beer).

Would definitely recommend!

THE BEST PIZZA!!!!  It was SO GOOD!!!  I wish I could have eaten more!!  Crunchy crust and lots of toppings!! Check out all the different pies in the pictures!!  They had everything you could think of!  So so good!!!!

A place to step away from the business of politicking... a few adult beverages and a nice meal and you will forget that you just walked two miles to see your representative or senator. Great food and atmosphere. I will definitely be visiting again to relax to the background music and tyranny talked about in the background. Good memories.

We were here for the capitol building tour and looking for some restaurants nearby to have lunch. This restaurant is only a 5mins walk. The food was delicious and waitress was nice. If you looking for something quick, I recommend here.

MAKE SURE YOU GET YOUR CARD BACK! Stopped in for beer and an app. Prices are crazy but they're high everywhere in the area. Service was alright, multiple people offered to take our order. Calamari came fast and was a decent amount for the price. Problem was our main server. We finished up and wanted to settle, he already had our card to charge and brought the booklet to sign. Time passed as we finished beers and hit the restroom. Hubby is good about double checking his cards before we leave places, he realized we were not given our credit card by the server. We waited a little longer, then hunted him down. He pulled out our card from his back pocket... if it were left at the card reader or something, that's one thing. To know we were done and leaving, if he "found" our card sitting at checkout he should have immediately brought it. Instead it was pocketed and the whole thing seems suspect.

Service was absolutely terrible. We waited almost 5 minutes to be seen and after the waiter took our food, we had to go find him after waiting 10+ minutes to get the bill.

The prices, I'll blame inflation on, but charging a party of 2 and automatic gratuity of 22% is nuts.

The food however was delicious.

Just walked 20 mins to get here.  There was an open table with 4 seats, I was by myself.  There were 3 people behind me waiting to be seated.  The lady refused to seat me because she said that there was 3 people she could seat instead.  Wow - and I had a group I was thinking of bringing here on Friday.

To the young woman host - be careful how you treat every customer as you just never know how important it could be.  A horrible experience from the start.  Bye!

Had a great brunch here! Everything was delicious. I was pleasantly surprised how good the pulled pork was in the cornbread waffle entree. The restaurant itself is very cute and has indoor and outdoor seating. Service was great - the food came out very quickly. Would definitely go back.

The food at this restaurant was so delicious, well beyond my expectations. Everyone at my table ordered seconds because it was so good. The champagne with our mimosas was also very nice. The service was a bit slow, but it was busy at brunch on a Saturday and we weren't exactly in a hurry to go. We sat outside and greatly enjoyed that, but inside the restaurant is beautiful, as well. Overall, I highly recommend giving this place a try, especially if you enjoy waffles!

Not good!
Pros: chef walked around and said hi to people which was nice. The design of their food is nice and well presented.
Our waiter had attitude! We purchased sparkling water then staff pour tab water on top of it! I ordered medium steak came in as a rare maybe medium rare, I asked just a little more cooked, after another 20 minutes came back as well-well done! We were part of 5, they were all done with their food so i didn’t say anything because was late at that point and wanted to get desert! At the end the check came in with 2% surcharges and 20% for such bad experience!

I have eaten here more than two dozen times mostly though it’s become my weekend early breakfast routine. I’ve had 80% of the breakfast/brunch menu items & am never disappointed. The waffles are amazing ( what you’d expect from a Belgium restaurant), the mushroom toast is so well seasoned snd a delight. The green eggs a really nice twist & I could go on… I loved the poached eggs with salmon and if you’re looking for traditional American
you can get it there too. I’ve also had the Flemish stew and mussels. The stew is extremely flavorful (a top notch culinary experience) and who can go wrong with a mussels in a white wine, garlic butter sauce with plenty of herbs to add the “wow” to the flavor. I am not a drinker but I did enjoy a really nice glass of Cabernet with the stew and it was an incredible match. They have a wide selection of wines. Overall if your looking for wonderful food experience, you’ll have it here. The service is also always great and Omar is my go to server. He adds a nice mix of professionalism/home style treatment. Amongst the best DC spots!

Lovely restaurant, very cozy rooftop brunch destination. I was super impressed by the buttermilk fried chicken and waffle. It screams aesthetics.

Four stars because the servers weren't super friendly. We made a reservation ahead of time for our one year anniversary brunch, but we had to be squeezed in and seated at the bar upon arrival. Overall amazing food, so I would still come back!

We went there during restaurant week for brunch. Everything was good, the food was delicious, the atmosphere was great. Our server was friendly and on time. I love it there and would go back for sure. The only reason I gave it 4 was because our server told us the champaign is $40 and he would give us some orange juice so we can make mimosa for ourself, however when the bill came, he charged us $56! When we asked why $56, he said $40 was the bottle the rest was the service for the Champagne and glasses and orange juice! I didn’t argue just because he was nice and the food was good otherwise I would have asked for manager.
Spacious and quiet place that's very nice for business meetings. I really enjoyed their steak tartare, one of the best I've had. The service was attentive and polite and food was served pretty fast.

We had the $25 prix fixe menu for restaurant week and it was amazing! The staff was very kind and the indoor decoration felt very luxurious. The service was quite prompt as well. We had made a reservation in advance so we didn't have to wait.

Had an amazing time here! The food was delicious and definitely had great portions. I had the duck and friends had other entrees - everyone loved what they ordered. Beautiful atmosphere and decorum here. I will say, my visit was extra special as two young people decided to spend forever with each other. The man was definitely happy the woman said Yes and the restaurant shared in their happiness. Beautiful scene, encourage others to come by. Parking will be on the street - stop by a few minutes early just in case you have a small walk.
The staff at Bistro Bis are top notch AMAZING! Everything I ate was so delicious and so were the drinks as well. I will definitely return to dinner here Every time I'm in DC.

This spot has a lot of character. I was here for a work dinner with a group of people so we had a prix menu. Very limited. The food was bland. The regular food outside our section did look much more colorful and tasty so hopefully it tastes better but I would not recommend it for a group outing. The server was not helpful at all. I asked what the chicken was stuffed with. His reply was “stuffing”. It ended up being stuffed with mushrooms and prosciutto which was fine but the staff should definitely be more informed, especially when assigned to a group with such a limited menu. The chowder was the best part.

Took my boyfriend here and was surprised by how affordable the prices for food and drink were (in comparison to the rest of DC). We visited on a Friday night while Congress was in recess so it was quiet, quick, and romantic. The food was great and definitely would visit again!

We were not crazy about the cookie but everything else was great!  We both got drinks, an entree, and a dessert for around ~$70.

I come here a lot for brunch. We really enjoy the quiet,  easy-going atmosphere, the good is good too. We have had a couple blunders where the cooks do not understand what scrambled eggs cooked well done means, but other than that, it's still one if our favorite places to grab breakfast!

By far, the best chicken tenders and crispy seasoned fries we've had in town. Even my cat was lurking around as soon as we opened the boxes and he's hardly ever interested in human food. Next time, I'd love to stay and dine in the restaurant. It's big, clean, and the food has been great and affordable.

If you’re a gin drinker and like refreshing cocktails, I’d recommend ordering the Basil Beauty. It was made with care by the bartender, who was friendly, yet professional. I was told the Capital Blossom cocktail is also a popular choice, but I didn’t try it this time. For food, I ordered the Patty Melt, subbed fries for chips. Fast service, really delicious food, and the atmosphere was welcoming and relaxed.

We found this place by accident.  What a wonderful little location!  I had super delicious blueberry pancake breakfast.  The coffee was terrific and the waiter was very attentive.  My coffee cup was never empty.

I loved the decor.  Loads of nostalgia along with a wonderful collection of antiques,  fire department gear and heads of stuffed wildlife.  It was fun just looking around at the walls and it's kitschy collections.

I came for the atmosphere; I stayed for the excellent service.  And I do mean really amazing service on a Sunday afternoon in February when this bartender was also covering the ALL of the table service as well!  Unfortunately, they were out of several tap beers, including Guinness, and a few menu items, including collard greens.  The French dip sandwich was decent, but nothing amazing.  The fried mushrooms really hit the spot though. I’ll be back again, maybe later in the year.
Hard to find but well worth it. Historic dive bar with excellent food and great service. Stop in and check it out. The beer was cold and the wings had some heat. Deep fried burger was perfect.

Super friendly service. Great atmosphere. Mozzarella sticks are huge! The breakfast quesadillas are delicious. The burger was great with huge slices of pickle. Recommend giving this place a shot. The pancake was the size of my plate and perfect.

Wonderful atmosphere, and service. Our server, Ricky was great. Told lots of jokes and really made some out of towners feel very welcomed.

The food was okay and felt a bit greasy. To the point that we had to wash our hands after. Would definitely go again. The Mac and cheese wedges were amazing!!!

The food was good and the service was quick. I ordered the Ruben with Tater Tots and my friend ordered the Chicken Cesar Wrap with Sweet Potato Fries. We both had coffee to drink and the bill including tip was around $20 per person. They had a nice selection of draft beers but unfortunately I was still too hungover to try any.

The restaurant vibe was just hands down so laid back and kind! Super nice people. Great great great food! Better than most other things I’ve been having in DC! Definitely recommend if you like a laid back pub/bar feel with awesome food and plenty of drinks for ya!
Great service, food was tasty. Very accommodating. Walked here from the National Galary of Art on a Saturday evening and was very satisfied with our experience.

The burgers were overrated IMO. I got the Rodeo and my companion got the Flamethrower. My burger tasted like an overpriced Carl's Jr burger minus the mayo. Overall it was dry, it had generic BBQ sauce on the bottom bun. The top bun had nothing on it. I had to ask for mayo and more bbq sauce. The portion is decent, and I did appreciate that they give you several options for sides without an additional cost. We tried the tater tots and sweet potato fries. They were good. And they also have a decent selection of beers. The seating is crowded inside, and they sat us right in front of the main entrance hallway where there's very dim lighting and everyone passes through. Our 'waiter' might have been the bartender or bus boy, bc he didn't have the same color shirt as the other guy, and had a very dry attitude, no customer service whatsoever.

Came into town last night , and tried this place it was close by, the meat was good on the Reuben but nothing to write home about, the service on the slow Tuesday was something else , waiting 15 minutes for my server to refill a drink. The food was average. Most likely wouldn’t come back here . The drinks also way over priced.

Very good Balkan restaurant. It is $50 per person for all you can eat of their so many but small dishes. I loved the size of their dishes. It was enough to just taste and order it again if you like it.  You can also pay $25 per person for unlimited drink or/and $8 for dessert. It is on a crowded street near the Capitol hill and Easter Market so maybe finding the parking is a bit of challenge specially over the weekend. The service could be a little better. We had to wait and even call the waiter when we needed something. Overall, a very good restaurant with unique experience that I'd highly recommend.

We love this restaurant and have been there three times already. Their selections and venues are great. We go for all inclusive menu for food and drink and we enjoy the inside and outside dining area. They would be able to speed up their preparation time since sometime it take a bit longer than usual but you still have some other food to bite on till they bring the next order because we order one extra portion anytime since we know the next portion takes longer so we have something to be busy working on it (although it may get cold sometime but better than waiting for your next meal to be prepared and show up on your table)
Hope you enjoy your time there and like their food and atmosphere

10/10 recommend Ambar!! The unlimited brunch is incredibly worth it. I tried as many things as I could before I was too full but the small plates help that! Starting with the spreads is perfect - a few different flavors and they were all so good. Then I had the tomato soup and the mini burger which were perfect if you’re looking for some lunch food. The grilled steak was my favorite dish for sure. Cooked perfectly and the flavor was phenomenal. I also had the potatoes hash and the strawberry waffle - a perfect way to end the meal! I cannot wait to go back.

Dining here for brunch was an experience. The ambiance and acoustics were grating and loud— it was difficult to hear speech from the waiter or from the table. The food was good, but not amazing. Nothing came out piping hot except the kebabs; everything was either cold or luke warm, including the veal soup. The Benedict dishes were soggy and watery from the poached egg. The favorite parts of the meal were the Balkan cheese and the waffles. It was nice that we could try as much as we wanted and we definitely left stuffed. The service was excellent and the staff were quick to remove empty dishes and ask if we wanted to order anything else. Perhaps the experience would be different at dinner; maybe it was exceptionally loud because of the unlimited drinks being served.

Great experience with all you can eat. Wide variation of items for selection and each item is like tapas style. Also each dish is decorated well and seasoned elegantly. If you come with a group, I'd recommend you try out as many dishes as you want as the portion size isn't too big.

Also note that the service can be slow as they get busier and sometimes items you order may not come until you almost forget about them. Other than that, I think this place is worth a visit and definitely worth the price.

Quick here and a lot of choices. The pizza is good as is the hot food but  a little expensive- especially when they are weighing pastas and sauces. The lemon chicken is my favorite and is really good when it is fresh! They have both round and aware pizza but the Square is not really that thick.  There is not a lot of seating here and sometimes it appears a little messy. There are healthy choices including salad and fruit which are on the food bar.
Good food and friendly service. The two guys sleeping in the dining area detracted from a wholly positive experience.

No more stuffed pizza. It was my favorite growing up. I asked if they make it still and they said they discontinued over the Summer of 2022.

Only place left is Arundel Mills Sbarro that has it.
As a Pizza Specialist, this Sbarro aint never let me down.

I was greeted by Carlos who was busy prepping when I walked into the Sbarro. The selection on breakfast menu items was listed. It was a nice healthy selection so I ordered eggs,potatoes and a biscuit.I'm vegetarian. I was asked if i was dining in or taking out.The food well done was placed into an aluminum pan and given to me on a tray as I chose to dine in. The price was a bit costly I added an apple juice and my total was 9.44. If it was not for the great customer service I would have walked out but food is expensive anyway so I had no problem paying. The quality of the food was what I expected and it was a pretty decent breakfast as I was feeling a bit sick before consumption and it helped make me feel better

This place is perfect for business dinner or with colleagues. Short, but professional menu with meat and seafood. Try steak or salmon, you will get the high end. The staff is kind and direct and the interior is very interesting. Recommended!

More of a 4.5... the Monocle is a DC institution on the Hill. It's a political hot spot with the volume to match. Lots of suits during the lunch crowd. Ambiance was busy with a more mature crowd.

Food was prepared well. We loved everything we ordered.
*crab cake, delicious! I loved it on a bed of avocado, yumm!
*Tenderloin salad-meat was tender and flavorful. A bit generous with the blue cheese.
*D Street Burger-my husband loved. It was prepared medium and tasty.
*crème brûlée was delicious!

We would definitely come back. There were a few hiccups with service but we still want to give this place another shot.

We really enjoyed this place. We had the hanger steak, salmon, calamari, Squash, berries, and creme brulee.  All were very good. Service was top notch. Decor was cool. I would definitely recommend this place.

Last night was my first time and I must say that my food was DELICIOUS! I got A Hennessy sidecar as my drink for my entree I got the Filet Mignon and the Gratin Potatoes my food came out nice fresh and hot just the way I like it!!! I’ll be back to visit ASAP

A great steak, sides and desert.  Excellent for groups and romantic dinners. Staff is top notch, never a dry glass. Staff knows there food and everyone there is passionate about giving u a great dinning experience.  Another must eat in DC.

It's a Starbucks. If you've come here wanting for a review, you've clearly been on Mars, in a cave, with your eyes shut and your fingers in your ears.
Starbucks serves good coffee for more than you'd like to pay for it, but you're probably going to buy it anyway. If you'd like, they'll serve it in a cup the size of a small bucket. There are also enormous whimsical iced drinks, whose names pay homage to tropical fruits that most people have never heard of, but which are mostly just fancy sugar water.
The service tends to be good. When crowds of people show up at the same time, service is slower, because making lots of drinks takes more time than making one drink. Yet somehow, people feel aggrieved about their own personal experience of being part of the crowd of people who slowed down service, and then blame the baristas, who are generally friendly while they do a job that involves odd hours and rude customers for not a great deal of pay.
Starbucks serves nice drinks, and is also a living laboratory of first-world problems and class divisions.

I’ve been coming to this starbucks for a while and this establishment definitely has a issue with homeless people. It is very difficult to do work or even relax. Every time I come here there’s always a disturbance of some sort, and there have been multiple instances where I worried about my safety. Please do something about this.

I've never been much of a fan of Starbucks until this visit here. The way they treated everyone that walked in the door no matter from what walks of life they started.   Ended here as equals and respected as what all truly are.. Human beings.. Thank You Starbucks on the corner of Pennsylvania Ave. & 3rd on the Hill in D.C. a place of what the American experience is supposed to be.
P.s. take care of Isaac he's a National Treasure..

Somthing needs to be done regarding the number of homeless that are allowed in this Starbucks. I come here often and there are a few that come around regularly who make myself and others very uncomfortable. They are loud and can be disruptive and rowdy. I understand that Starbucks has changed their policy in regards to this, but these individuals do cause disturbances.

I agree with some other comments, the staff is very rude and unprofessional. Today I ordered decaf Americano but they brought me cappuccino for some reason. I told the employee at least two times that I want Americano (not Cappuccino) . I order decaf Americano at other Starbucks almost every day and never have any problems. Then she started to look at me like I told her something rude ( with hate face expression and laugh). She said to other employee : there is something wrong with that guy he said Cappuccino, etc, and they were really rude, and looked at me with hate on their faces. Being Starbucks customer almost every day last 10 years I see such rude service first time.

Station 4 is a great place for Sunday Brunch with friends. My recent encounter was electrifying and refreshing. The food was really good, and the cocktails were good as well. There was a DJ playing music and accepting music requests from patrons. I was so anxious when I received my food, I almost forget to take a picture. However, I did capture a picture before finishing my meal. I would definitely recommend this location. My only suggestion is for you to call and make a reservation prior to arrival because the restaurant fills pretty fast and you may not have a chance to be seated if you don’t have one.

Went here for a Christmas Eve brunch and we loved it! The food great and drinks were good (strong😏)…. Maybe because it wasn’t busy lol. My favorite was the duck fries but overall their were tasty and good portion size. The metro (water front-green line) is right across the restaurant and parking garage is right around the corner.

ok had the Duck Fat Fries. They were crispy and good. Tried the watermelon steak salad... it's a winner SANS the ranch dressing( get vinaigrette). All the food was fresh and beautifully prepared.  Best stuff Salmon with crispy skin. Angel was my waiter and he was nice and patience. Nice ambience, for me easy parking. I'm coming back for happy hour.

Brunch was pretty good. The atmosphere is cool and some of the servers were on point, others not so much.  I had to send my steak and eggs back because I couldn't cut the steak, and I was using a steak knife.  I sent that order back (which I hate to do), and got the shrimp and grits instead. It was really good, tasty, and well seasoned. To go with our meal we had a bottle of Prosecco, an Irish coffee, and some tequila shots.
There was no music or any extra frills, but it was a decent brunch.

Good service and great food. I booked my reservation on OpenTable. The table was ready when we arrived. The servers was nice and attentive to our needs. The food came out quickly and it was hot! The bathroom was well stocked and clean. Parking was available on the street.
